title: App Icon - Image Check
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the app has been installed
custom_steps:
WHEN we select/highlight the app
AND move the direction pad in all directions - slightly, not enough to nav away
custom_expected:
THEN we see the image and the app icon appears as expected 
AND the layers are set in a way that does not appear odd or incorrect

title: App Version
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the app has been installed
AND the app has been launched
custom_steps: WHEN we navigate to Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the version text appears as expected in the bottom right corner

Example:
version: 2.3.0 (1362)

title: Side Load - Install Fresh and Hard Quit
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
AND the MLB.TV app is not installed on our device
AND we have access to a Premium Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we install the build
AND we log in with a Premium Account
AND we exit the app
AND we tap the tvOS remote's Home button to return to tvOS Home
AND we double tap the Home button
AND we swipe up to Hard Quit the app
AND we relaunch the app
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view
AND the user is logged in to the same account

title: Side Load - Install Over Previous App - Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the side load version of the previous release (LIVE)
AND we have previously logged in to the app in the previous release
AND we have access to the latest Prod-facing build in test
custom_steps:
WHEN we Side load the current build in test
AND we launch the build
custom_expected:
THEN the app launches as expected to the expected view
AND we do not see the onboarding flow screens
AND the user is logged in to the same account

title: Verify: MLB.TV can be accessed while the AppleTV (Gen 4) device is connected wirelessly

custom_steps: WHEN the user selects MLB.TV from the device Apps menu
custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV app will open successfully

custom_expected: THEN the MLB.TV app will open successfully

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt in newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account is set to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send opted-in email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been tagged with opt-in group “428” (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing)

title: Create Free MLB.TV account - opt out of newsletter
custom_preconds:
Freshly installed app is launched 
User is not logged in 
User has advanced through Onboarding flow to Create Account page
User has a test email account that can be accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN we enter an email address
AND create a PW 8-15 characters in length with at least one upper-case letter, one lowercase letter and one number
AND confirm password
custom_expected:
THEN the app logs the user in 
AND advances to the In-Game alerts page
AND the user's email account does not show an opt-in to receive the newsletter

To confirm this, user must send the email account to DBAdmin@mlb.com asking them to confirm that it has been NOT tagged with opt-in group “428” (which may be an invalid group but out of scope for client-side testing)

title: Targeted User Sees Rate Me
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user has installed the app
AND has previously logged in
AND that the user's tvOS device is connected to Charles SSL Proxy via Apple Configurator (2)
AND collected the tt.omtrdc.net request
AND has noted the "device.id" number
custom_steps:
WHEN the device.id # is targeted
AND the user launches the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the Rate Me modal
AND the text will appear as noted in http://device-config.mlb.com/device-config/v1/mlbtv-messages/en-US/tvos-v2.json

title: User dismisses Rate Me via Menu
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user's device has been targeted to see the Rate Me modal
AND the app has been launched
AND the user sees the Rate Me modal
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Menu button on the tvOS remote
custom_expected:
THEN the Rate Me modal is dismissed
AND does not appear during current app session

title: User dismisses Rate Me via "Not Yet"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user's device has been targeted to see the Rate Me modal
AND the app has been launched
AND the user sees the Rate Me modal
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects and activates the Not Yet button
custom_expected:
THEN the Rate Me modal is dismissed
AND does not re-appear during current app session

title: User opts for "OK" and is taken to MLB.tv page in iTunes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user's device has been targeted to see the Rate Me modal
AND the app has been launched
AND the user sees the Rate Me modal
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects and activates the OK button
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to MLB.tv Page in iTunes
AND user can thereafter return to the app via "Menu" backing through the app to Games View

Note: User cannot access iTunes store while running Charles SSL proxying.

title: User does not see Rate Me based on rateMeMaybeLaterCount via Not Yet
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user has installed the app
AND has previously logged in
AND that the user's tvOS device is connected to Charles SSL Proxy via Apple Configurator (2)
AND collected the tt.omtrdc.net request
AND has noted the "rateMeMaybeLaterCount"
custom_steps:
WHEN the Adobe Settings have been set to NOT show the Rate Me modal rateMeMaybeLaterCount for one beyond the current count
AND the user then launches the app
AND sees the Rate Me modal
AND dismisses via Not Yet
custom_expected: THEN when launching the app again the user will not see the Rate Me modal

title: User does not see Rate Me based on rateMeMaybeLaterCount via Menu
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user has installed the app
AND has previously logged in
AND that the user's tvOS device is connected to Charles SSL Proxy via Apple Configurator (2)
AND collected the tt.omtrdc.net request
AND has noted the "rateMeMaybeLaterCount"
custom_steps:

AND sees the Rate Me modal
AND dismisses via Menu

title: User does not see Rate Me based on rateMeOkCount
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user has installed the app
AND has previously logged in
AND that the user's tvOS device is connected to Charles SSL Proxy via Apple Configurator (2)
AND collected the tt.omtrdc.net request
AND has noted the "rateMeOkCount"
custom_steps:
WHEN the Adobe Settings have been set to NOT show the Rate Me modal rrateMeOkCount for one beyond the current count
AND the user then launches the app
AND sees the Rate Me modal
AND selects & activates OK
AND then returns to app and exits to tvOS Home
custom_expected: THEN when launching the app again the user will not see the Rate Me modal

title: User only sees Rate Me in Games view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user's device has been targeted to see the Rate Me modal every time
AND the app has been fully quit (double tap Home button and dismiss)
AND the app has been launched
AND the user sees the Rate Me modal in Games view
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to Highlights
AND presses the Menu button on the tvOS remote to exit app
AND launches app to Highlights
AND the user navigates to Standings 
AND presses the Menu button on the tvOS remote to exit app
AND launches app to Standings
AND the user navigates to Settings 
AND presses the Menu button on the tvOS remote to exit app
AND launches app to Settings
AND then navigates to Games view
custom_expected: THEN the user will only see the Rate Me modal in Games view

title: Voice Over On
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the tvOS device has Voice Over set to On in Settings (General > Accessibility > Voice Over On)
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate through the app
AND view all screens
custom_expected:
THEN the Voice Over will offer helpful guidance
AND the app navigation does not get blocked

Note: We do not currently have any known requirements for this aspect of tvOS but we can offer a PASS for this case if the app does not have any technical problems or new failures. We should focus on newly added screens and look for hiccups in the voiceover. An example of a non-issue is that Voiceover does not read the full Standings data back...but that is acceptable as the area is not interactive and to enable that would lock the user up for the duration of the read-back (which would also sound nearly nonsensical).

Known issue https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WOLF-508 - User cannot access dropdown for Video UI when Voiceover set to On during Video Playback
